intro: Pleuroplitis langsdorffii var. centrasiatica, commonly known as the Central Asian pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to Central Asia. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
